info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 2:17PM EDT until May 16 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Columbia County in east central New York... * Until 315 PM EDT. * At 216 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Livingston, or 9 miles southeast of Hudson, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chatham, Claverack, Livingston, Copake, New Lebanon, Austerlitz, Ancram, Philmont, Claverack-Red Mills, Ghent, Hillsdale, Canaan, Taghkanic, Churchtown, Linlithgo Mills, North Hillsdale, Harlemville, Silvernails, Spaulding Furnace and Buckleyville. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
